file_insights.significance: Tracks project build state and subtask completion progress

patterns_discovered.description: The .auto-claude-status file is automatically updated after successful subtask completion, indicating an automated CI/CD or build system tracking mechanism
Subtasks are processed in order with clear state transitions (in_progress to completed), suggesting a structured workflow
Each session is numbered and timestamped, allowing for debugging and tracking of work progress across multiple invocations

gotchas_discovered.description: Session number jumped from 7 to 9, skipping session 8. This could indicate a skipped session, parallel processing, or automatic session increment logic
Completed subtasks increased by 2 (6 to 8) in a single update for subtask-2-4, suggesting either batch processing of multiple subtasks or error in counting

approach_outcome.description: Database schema verification subtask completed successfully
approach_outcome.details: Subtask 2-4 focused on verifying database tables were created with correct schema. The successful completion was recorded in the status file with proper state management.

recommendations.recommendation: Investigate the session number gap (7→9) to ensure no sessions are being silently skipped or lost
Document the relationship between session numbers and completed subtask increments to clarify batch processing behavior
Add validation checks to ensure subtask counts increment correctly and audit logs capture all session transitions
Verify that database schema verification actually validated table structure, primary keys, indexes, and constraints
